subject: Career
title: Async-First Communication
description: A quick win: understand Async-First Communication.

hook.text: Your teammate is in Tokyo. You're in London. Synchronous communication means someone works at 3 AM.

buildup.text: Async-first means defaulting to messages, docs, and recordings instead of live meetings.

discovery.text: GitLab, a fully remote company of 2,000+, operates almost entirely async with a public handbook.

twist.text: Async isn't slower â€” it's more thoughtful. People can compose better responses without real-time pressure.

climax.text: Reserve sync (meetings) for brainstorming, sensitive topics, and relationship building. Everything else: async.

punchline.text: Default to async. Escalate to sync when it matters.

quiz.question: What does async-first communication mean?
options: Defaulting to messages and docs instead of live meetings
